sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A discourse sent to the late King James, to persuade him to embrace the Protestant religion by Dr. Samuel Parker, Late Lord Bishop of Oxford ; to which are prefixed two letters ; the first, from Sir Leolyn Jenkins, on the same subject, the second, from the said bishop, with the discourse ; printed from the original manuscript papers, without observation or reflection. Parker, Samuel, 1640-1688. Jenkins, Leoline, Sir, 1623-1685.
[6], 3-32 p.
Printed and are to be sold by Randel Taylor ..., London : 1690.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
A discourse sent to the late King James, to persuade him to embrace the Protestant religion by Dr. Samuel Parker, Late Lord Bishop of Oxford ; to which are prefixed two letters ; the first, from Sir Leolyn Jenkins, on the same subject, the second, from the said bishop, with the discourse ; printed from the original manuscript papers, without observation or reflection. Parker, Samuel, 1640-1688. Jenkins, Leoline, Sir, 1623-1685.
[6], 3-32 p.
Printed and are to be sold by Randel Taylor ..., London : 1690.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
